body.name: Self-Adhesive Wood Stove Gasket Tape, 9ft x 13/16in x 1/8in High-Temperature Resistant Graphite Impregnated Fiberglass Replacement Gasket, for Woodburning Coal Stoves Smokers, 2pcs
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 3 hrs 15 mins
features: SUITABLE SIZE: Each gasket is 1/8 inches thick, 13/16 inches wide, and 54 inches long(Total length: 9 feet). Please measure the size of the stove before purchasing. Our replacement gaskets are suitable for wood-burning stoves, fireplaces. You can buy them with confidence.

HIGH-TEMPERATURE RESISTANT MATERIAL: These firewall damper seal gaskets are made of graphite impregnated fiberglass. This material is wear-resistant and pressure-resistant without any peculiar smell. Its limit temperature is 1022 ° f (550 ° C), which can well adapt to the state of furnace combustion.

GOOD SEALING EFFECT: 1/8inches thick flat Fiberglass Gaskets Tape can firmly stick to the stove. Its excellent air tightness prevents smoke and ash from leaking out of the furnace. It will not only help you keep your space tidy but also try to avoid accidents caused by sparks.

EASY-TO-USE ADHESIVE BACKING: Unlike Adhesive Cement, our fireplace gaskets come with self-adhesive backing that makes them easier to use. Just peel off the brown paper and it will stick well to the stove. There is no need to rush to squeeze glue, let alone worry about glue sticking everywhere.

WHAT YOU'LL RECEIVE: You'll receive 2 flat wood stove gaskets with self-adhesive backing. Save yourself the hassle of buying again while getting an affordable gasket. Make your stove burn more efficiently with our high-temperature resistant wood stove door gaskets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked well to replace a deteriorated gasket in my wood stove
reviews.reviewText: Worked perfect to replace the old worn out gasket on the clean out cap on my wood stove. It was easy to cut and install and the self adhesive worked perfectly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install. You need to purchase glue/cement as well.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to replace seal on my wood stove door. Watched a few YouTube videos to learn how to do it.You will need some cement/epoxy/glue to install the seal/rope.Very happy with the result.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works well, better than the glue style

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It is much thinner than the one I replaced, but there was enough to make two layers.
reviews.reviewText: I was surprised at how well this gasket worked. I was able to easily measure and cut it to fit using a regular pair of scissors, and it tucked right into place. It stayed put too. It does not come with directions, but there is a yellow backing to the strip of adhesive that you will need to remove prior to placing it. That is pretty self-explanatory, but it did take a little bit of work to get the backing off of the gasket material and that can make you wonder for a second if it needs to stay. There was plenty to fully enclose the channel for our vintage wood stove's door with two layers for me with a few inches of material left over. It is thinner than expected as it does not completely fill the depth of the channel as the older gasket did, but what it lacks in bulk it makes up for in function and performance. It works really well and makes a much tighter seal than the one I replaced. If you prefer to have a thicker gasket, simply purchase two of these and run 3 or 4 layers through your channels, and you will be pleased. I am so far. It adheres well to the metal in the channel, even when it is hot, and it also adheres well to itself. I'm pleased overall. I am docking it a point for not including any sort of directions as a lot of people probably wouldn't realize that the yellow strip needs to be removed first, particularly if you are replacing a rope-style gasket that does not use adhesive, and this would prevent it from adhering. Keeping the strip intact would certainly lead to poor performance and unnecessary frustration.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Cleaned my stove and applied. Work great no issues yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Adhesive Falls Off
reviews.reviewText: Do not buy. It is a waste of money, on first burn of the year the new gaskets fell off, with the adhesive backing staying stuck to the doors and then having to be peeled off. Now I will have to buy the gasket cement which I should have just done in the beginning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars They don't stick really well
reviews.reviewText: When I first got them they were great but they seem to quickly lose their stickiness. I ended up having to use gasket cement to put them back on. this wouldn't have been a problem except when these say self adhesive they should self adhere.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install sticks very well!
Good product was as described and easy to work with. The real test is yet to come. Haven’t used the wood heater yet this year
Applied to our wood stove and it just fell off
